title: Foundation: Interest and Basic Skills
description: A passion for beauty and style is the starting point. Practice on friends and family to develop a feel for makeup, hairstyling, and other beauty treatments. A G.C.E. O/L is generally sufficient for entry into training programs.

title: Professional Diploma and NVQ Qualification
description: Enroll in a comprehensive hairdressing and beauty therapy course at a reputable academy. The goal is to get a recognized diploma and an NVQ Level 4 qualification, which covers all the core skills of the profession.

title: Beautician / Hairstylist
description: Work in a professional salon. This is where you will build your speed, refine your techniques, and learn how to handle a diverse range of clients and requests. Building a loyal client base is the key to success at this stage.

title: Senior Stylist / Salon Manager
description: Become a senior stylist, who is often the most in-demand and highest-earning professional in the salon. You can also move into a management role, overseeing the salon's daily operations, managing staff, and handling inventory.

title: Own Your Own Salon
description: With a strong reputation, a loyal client base, and good business sense, you can take the entrepreneurial step of opening your own salon. This involves finding a location, branding, hiring staff, and managing all aspects of the business.
